item.title: Beyond: Two Souls TV Series on the Way from Star Elliot Page
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/beyond-two-souls-tv-series-on-the-way-from-star-elliot-page

PlayStation and Quantic Dream‚Äôs story-driven adventure game Beyond: Two Souls is getting a TV series reimagining from original star Elliot Page.

Deadline reports that Page‚Äôs Pageboy Productions has acquired the rights from Quantic Dream in the hopes of adapting it into a television show. The project is said to be in early development and is expected to keep the video game experience‚Äôs non-linear narrative in mind as work progresses. Additional details, including casting information and release plans, have yet to be revealed.

Page told Deadline that filming Beyond: Two Souls was ‚Äúone of the most challenging and fulfilling acting experiences‚Äù of his career. He continued: ‚ÄúThe story‚Äôs rich narrative and emotional depth offer us a fantastic foundation. We want to create a unique vision of the characters and their journeys that resonates with fans and newcomers.‚Äù

Every IGN Quantic Dream Review

Pageboy head of development and production Matt Jordan Smitt elaborated on how he, Page, and the rest of the team plan to ‚Äúhonor the game‚Äôs legacy while inviting fresh perspectives.‚Äù He added: ‚ÄúDelving into questions of survival and how split-second decisions can alter not just our lives, but the lives of others, are key to telling the story.‚Äù

The original Beyond: Two Souls launched for the PlayStation 3 in 2013 before eventually making its way to PlayStation 4 and PC in 2015 and 2019, respectively. Directed and written by Quantic Dream‚Äôs David Cage, it follows the story of Jodie Holmes, a girl with psychic powers that allow her to communicate with a spirit she calls Aiden. Aside from the non-linear narrative that explores different sections of her life, the game was known for its inclusion of big-name actors like Page and Willem Dafoe.

Cage said he is collaborating with Page on the Beyond: Two Souls TV show, though the extent of his involvement is unclear.

‚ÄúWe are absolutely thrilled to collaborate again with Elliot Page on this project,‚Äù Cage said. ‚ÄúI was blown away by his acting performance in the game, and I couldn‚Äôt think of anyone else to tell this story with the same passion on another medium. Beyond: Two Souls is a very special game for millions of players around the world who were moved by the story of Jodie and Aiden, and their journey in life and beyond. I know that Elliot has all the talent and instinct to make it something really unique on TV.‚Äù

It will be some time before the Beyond: Two Souls TV series makes its debut. In the meantime, you can see IGN‚Äôs original review for the game here and all of our Quantic Dream video game reviews here.

Michael Cripe is a freelance contributor with IGN. He's best known for his work at sites like The Pitch, The Escapist, and OnlySP.

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 Publisher Addresses Community Complaints About a Lack of Content, Reveals What‚Äôs Coming Down the Line
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/warhammer-40000-space-marine-2-publisher-addresses-community-complaints-about-a-lack-of-content-reveals-whats-coming-down-the-line

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 publisher Focus Entertainment has addressed growing frustration over a lack of content and outlined what players can expect in the coming months.

Space Marine 2 enjoyed a record-breaking launch late last year, eventually shifting 5 million copies while becoming the fastest-selling Warhammer video game of all time.

In recent weeks, however, some within the game‚Äôs community have complained that developer Saber Interactive hasn‚Äôt provided enough new reasons to keep playing.

In a new blog post, Focus Entertainment reiterated its commitment to supporting Space Marine 2 throughout 2025 and beyond, promising new skins, new PvP and PvE maps, custom lobbies for PvP, the long-awaited Horde mode, PvE prestige ranks, and new weapons all this year. Meanwhile, the Datavault update arrives in February with update 6.0.

In its statement, Focus Entertainment told players to expect updates every two months and that while it would ‚Äúlove to do more,‚Äù it‚Äôs focusing on delivering polished updates, ‚Äúwhich takes time and care.‚Äù

‚ÄúSpace Marine 2 has been out for four months, and your continued enthusiasm means the world to us,‚Äù Focus Entertainment said in its statement.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not done with it! You can expect updates every two months. We‚Äôd love to do more, but we‚Äôre committed to delivering polished updates, which takes time and care! Thank you for your patience, understanding, and unwavering support.‚Äù

It‚Äôs also worth noting that Space Marine 2‚Äôs 6.0 update adds a perks rework and the long-awaited Field of View (FOV) slider for PC. ‚ÄúYou expressed how eager you were to get a FOV slider since the launch,‚Äù Focus Entertainment said. ‚ÄúWhile implementing it has been technically challenging, we‚Äôve finally managed to produce a slider worthy of our standards, introduced in version 6.0.

‚ÄúWe hope this new feature will meet your expectations!‚Äù

There‚Äôs no release date yet for Space Marine 2‚Äôs patch 6.0, but it sounds like it‚Äôs coming very soon. Continue below for everything announced so far.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 update 6.0:

NEW PVP MAP - TOMB

A new PvP map is about to be implemented in the 6.0 update! We already hinted that it will be set in a closed environment with many narrow passages pushing you to engage more in Closed Quartered Battles.

It takes place beneath the surface of Demerium, amongst the haunting structures of in a Necron tomb. It‚Äôs a closed environment with many narrow passages. Pay extra attention because there are blind spots. There‚Äôs also a wider area to let you switch combat style.

NEW ENEMY - BIOVORE

The Biovore is a new enemy in PvE, in all maps featuring Tyranids. It‚Äôs an Extremis enemy, a dreadful foe both in distance and melee combat. Beware of the Spore Mines ithe shoots.

Don‚Äôt forget to dodge and then aim at the Spore Mine to destroy them before impact.

Do not falter, Brother. You‚Äôve got this.

SALAMANDERS CHAMPION

We announced it last month: The Salamanders Champion is here! One of the Loyalist First Founding Chapters of the Space Marines.

Available for the Sniper class, with both skins for your Champion and for your Bolt Sniper Rifle: adorn that green paint, those flames and go dominate the battlefield.

RAVEN GUARD COMING!

The Raven Guard are joining the fight! New cosmetics will soon be available with the season pass including the fan-favorite: ‚ú®ü¶Ö beaky helmet ü¶Ö‚ú® (MK VI ‚ÄúCorvus‚Äù) and Raven Guard trinkets.

Take a first look at it:

The MK VI ‚ÄúCorvus‚Äù helmet comes both with and without the Raven Guard emblem, allowing you to customize your Space Marine for your convenience.

DATAVAULT

The Datavault makes its entry to the Battle Barge!

In this new area, you will find unlockable information on most elements from the game in the Research Centre, as well as cosmetic rewards. To unlock them, you will need a new special currency, earned via in-game achievements (called Ordeals), in all modes (Campaign, PvE and PvP). Time to challenge yourself!

Here‚Äôs the kind of Ordeals you‚Äôll have to complete to unlock the currency:

  • Complete any Mission in Operations mode on Average Threat Level or higher.
  • Knock back Spore Mines to kill Tyranids.
  • Make a Carnifex stun itself in Operations mode.

PERKS REWORK

In a past Community Update, we mentioned that we were not completely satisfied with the quality of perks. We‚Äôve reworked some of them, and these enhancements will be introduced in the next update release. More changes will come on the perks in the future, and we hope this first change on the perks feel more satisfying and engaging. We‚Äôre all ears, so don‚Äôt hesitate to share your feedback!

FOV SLIDER FOR PC

You expressed how eager you were to get a FOV Slider since the launch. While implementing it has been technically challenging, we‚Äôve finally managed to produce a slider worthy of our standards, introduced in version 6.0.

We hope this new feature will meet your expectations!

AND MORE

  • New finisher animations on Zoanthropes, Scarab Occult Terminators and Rubric Marines.
  • A new functionality will be added, allowing you to upgrade your Master-Crafted and Artificer Armoury Data to Relic by trading them. You can also sell your Armoury Data to get Requisition Points.

A new difficulty mode with cosmetic rewards will be added for the braves able to successfully complete Operations in this more intense difficulty: a bloodstained Knife Combat and a new pauldron. Note that this new difficulty will only be available if you have completed at least 1 Operation in Lethal Difficulty.

  • Base Decals available for Right Pauldrons (This one‚Äôs for you, Deathwatch players)
  • A new option to share your skin between PvE and PvP modes will be added. You‚Äôll no longer need to remake the same skin for both modes! This option also allows you to share your patterns between classes.
  • PvP Crossplay Toggle On/Off: allows console players to play with PC players. You now have the option to be matched with either PC players or Console players independently.
  • üï∫ Emotes üï∫ Strengthen the bond with your fellow Brothers with the new emotes! So go ahead and use them without moderation.

item.title: Mass Effect 5: BioWare Doesn't 'Require Support From the Full Studio', EA Moves Some Staff to Other Teams
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/mass-effect-5-bioware-doesnt-require-support-from-the-full-studio-ea-moves-some-staff-to-other-teams

Mass Effect to be led by team of series veterans.

EA has announced it is restructuring Dragon Age and Mass Effect studio BioWare, moving a number of developers onto other projects within EA and focusing entirely on its upcoming Mass Effect game going forward.

In a blog post from general manager Gary McKay, he wrote that the studio is "taking this opportunity between full development cycles to reimagine how we work at BioWare."

"Given this stage of development, we don‚Äôt require support from the full studio," he continues. "We have incredible talent here at BioWare, and so we have worked diligently over the past few months to match many of our colleagues with other teams at EA that had open roles that were a strong fit."

IGN understands that EA has already placed an unknown number of developers from BioWare into other, equivalent roles within the company. A smaller number of Dragon Age team members are also seeing their roles terminated, and are being offered time to apply to other roles within the company if they so choose.

BioWare's structure has shifted repeatedly in recent years. The studio had a round of layoffs in 2023., and has seen a number of high-profile departures throughout the development of Dragon Age: The Veilguard, the most recent of which was director Corinne Busche announcing her departure from the studio last week. It is unclear how many individuals work at BioWare today. IGN asked EA for any comment or specifics on how many individuals at BioWare are being impacted by this change, how many are facing potential layoffs, and how many will remain at the studio. EA did not provide the specifics, but a spokesperson offered the following comment:

"The studio's priority was Dragon Age. During this time there were people continuing to build the vision for the next Mass Effect. Now that The Veilguard has shipped, the studio's full focus is Mass Effect.

"While we're not sharing numbers, the studio has the right number of people in the right roles to work on Mass Effect at this stage of development."

The new Mass Effect in question was announced four years ago, and is still in the early stages of development. IGN understands that BioWare's current strategy is to prioritize one game at a time, as some developers who had been working on Mass Effect were previously moved to Dragon Age to get the project over the finish line and are now moving back. Per the blog post, Mass Effect development is now being led by series veterans including Mike Gamble, Preston Watamaniuk, Derek Watts, and Parrish Ley.

This news comes a week after EA announced that Dragon Age: The Veilguard missed its player targets by nearly 50% and reduced its guidance for the fiscal year due to this and, more impactfully, weaker-than-expected results from EA Sports FC 25. The company will hold its Q3 earnings conference call on February 4.

Rebekah Valentine is a senior reporter for IGN. You can find her posting on BlueSky @duckvalentine.bsky.social. Got a story tip? Send it to rvalentine@ign.com.

item.title: PlayStation Plus Games for February 2025 Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/playstation-plus-games-for-february-2025-announced

Payday 3, High on Life, and more.

Sony has announced the PlayStation Plus Essential Tier games for February 2025 are Payday 3 (PS5), High on Life (PS4 and PS5), and Pac-Man World Re-Pac (PS4 and PS5).

Revealed on the PlayStation Blog, all three games will be made available at no extra cost to PlayStation Plus subscribers on February 4.

Payday 3 is the struggling cooperative heist shooter from Starbreeze Entertainment that had such a disastrous launch that, at least on PC where data is available, more players are online playing its predecessor.

A highlight of the launch and follow up attempts to revive the game included Starbreeze releasing what it called the highly anticipated "offline mode" which required an online connection to access and made the game run worse than normal. Starbreeze said in November it will make a "significantly lower level of investment‚Äù in the game‚Äôs second year.

High on Life, meanwhile, is a bizarre first person shooter where players take on the role of an intergalactic bounty hunter that uses living, foul-mouthed guns to fight aliens.

It launched first onto Xbox before joining PlayStation in 2023, and earned an 8/10 in IGN's review. "High on Life is a laugh-out-loud funny space odyssey that‚Äôs chaotic, bizarre, and a ton of fun," we said.

Finally, Pac-Man World Re-Pac is a remaster of the 1999 platformer with improved UI, fine-tuned mechanics, and updated visuals.

"Pac-Man arrives home on his birthday to find the Ghosts have kidnapped Pac-Man‚Äôs family and friends and ruined his party," reads the official synopsis. "Off to the rescue, Pac-Man sets out to Ghost Island. Dodge Ghosts, solve environmental puzzles, rescue the Pac-Fam, and more in this platforming adventure."

Payday 3, High on Life, and Pac-Man World Re-Pac will be available be available at no extra cost until March 3. Those who've yet to add January 2025's PlayStation Plus games to their library ‚Äî Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, Need for Speed: Hot Pursuit Remastered, and The Stanley Parable ‚Äî have until February 3 to do so.

Ryan Dinsdale is an IGN freelance reporter. He'll talk about The Witcher all day.

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons VR Game Re-Emerges With Official Name and Announcement Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/dungeons-dragons-vr-game-re-emerges-with-official-name-and-announcement-trailer

A year after it was announced, Resolution Games‚Äô official Dungeons & Dragons VR game has a final name and an announcement trailer.

Resolution Games, best known for digital fantasy tabletop adventure Demeo, is working with Wizards of the Coast on the first virtual reality game set in the Dungeons & Dragons universe, called Demeo x Dungeons & Dragons: Battlemarked. It‚Äôs due out on PC, consoles, and XR devices, although the platform specifics and release date are yet to be announced.

The trailer, below, doesn't give much away, teasing the premise of the game with a live-action set-up before a glimpse at what to expect from the art style. Resolution Games is yet to show off gameplay or any screenshots.

Wizards of the Coast SVP of Digital Strategy & Licensing Eugene Evans said that Resolution Games is taking a different approach to Dungeons & Dragons by putting the emphasis on fast, turn-based combat and pick-up-and-play mechanics.

Battlemarked adapts D&D classes, actions, and lore to Resolution Games‚Äô Demeo action role-playing system, which is DM-less and focuses on social strategy rather than social roleplay. This, Resolution Games said, encourages group tabletalk focused on tactics and decision-making.

‚ÄúWith the launch of Demeo back in 2021, we began to grow an incredible relationship with the D&D player community,‚Äù said Tommy Palm, founder and CEO of Resolution Games.

‚ÄúDemeo and Demeo Battles quickly became a game night substitute for Dungeon Masters who wanted an out-of-campaign way to have fun with their groups, and for D&D players to introduce their friends and family to tabletop miniatures games.‚Äù

There‚Äôs cross-platform support for up to four players co-operatively, with two story-based campaigns at launch and additional campaigns in different D&D settings planned as downloadable content in the future.
